description: Sum of remainders n mod p, over all primes p < n.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: a(5) = 3. The remainder when 5 is divided by primes 2, 3 respectively is 1, 2, and their sum = 3.10 = 2*5+0 = 3*3+1 = 5*2+0 = 7*1+3: a(10) = 0+1+0+3 = 4.
maple: A024934:=proc(q)local a,i,n;for n from 1 to q doa:=0; for i from 1 to n do if isprime(i) then a:=a+(n mod i); fi; od; print(a);od; end:A024934(100); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Apr 16 2012.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
